title: True of the marginal propensity to consume

content.prompt: Which of the following is true about the marginal propensity to consume?

choices.label: It is the percentage of total income that is spent on consumption.
It determines the size of the simple spending multiplier.
It increases as incomes increase because increases in income cause people to spend more.
It is the same as the money multiplier.
It is equal to the average propensity to consume for people with low incomes.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe economic concepts, principles, or models.
